questions.question_text: When viewing quick table calculations, such as Percent Difference from, that use a value in the previous column, what will be the first data value in the visualization?
Which two types of aggregations can be applied to string fields? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: AD
sum & avg cant be applied on strings

Selected Answer: AD
You cannot have sum nor average from string fields. Only A and D are correct
A and D

Selected Answer: AD
A. Minimum
D. Count Distinct

Selected Answer: AD
AD should ne the correct

Selected Answer: AD
sum and avg cant appy on a string dimension

Selected Answer: AD
sum and avg cant appy on a string dimension
Minimum and Count distinct are correct
What’s the correct answer

Selected Answer: AD
a & d ARE CORRECT
This answer is wrong. String fields only can be aggregatted by MIN, MAX, COUNT and COUNTD. (Not by SUM or AVG)

Selected Answer: AD
dimension cannot be summed for example date ( cannot take the sum of dates)

Selected Answer: AD
https://help.tableau.com/current/pro/desktop/en-us/calculations_aggregation.htm
You can aggregate a dimension in the view as Minimum, Maximum, Count, or Count (Distinct). When you aggregate a dimension, you create a new temporary measure column, so the dimension actually takes on the characteristics of a measure.
